trans-unit.source: Provides data for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent"></xref> event that is raised when the template mode changes for a control on the design surface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event is raised by a designer host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], for certain actions on a control on the design surface.
For example, an event is raised when you enter or exit template editing mode for a control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event.

When you exit or enter template editing mode, the designer host initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> event type, and then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property with a TemplateModeChangedEventArgs object.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object indicates that the template mode has changed, the default delegate in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class updates the value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A> property.

Custom designers that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner> class can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method to perform additional processing when the template editing mode changes for a control on the design surface.
For more information about events and delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateModeChangedEventArgs"></xref> class with the specified template group.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> delegate method uses the TemplateModeChangedEventArgs constructor to initialize a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateModeChangedEventArgs> object for use with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object.

When you exit or enter template editing mode, the designer host initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> event type, and then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateModeChangedEventArgs> object.
The `newTemplateGroup` parameter specifies a new template group when you enter template editing mode.
The `newTemplateGroup` parameter is typically `null` for exiting template editing mode.
A new template group that is used to initialize the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateModeChangedEventArgs.NewTemplateGroup*>.
Gets the template group that was created when you entered template editing mode.
The NewTemplateGroup property specifies a new template group when you enter template editing mode.
NewTemplateGroup is `null`for events that are raised when you exit template editing mode.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup"></xref> if you entered template editing mode with a new template; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
